title: Bug 47910: ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When I use the ajc command with the parameters sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar, an output file with a .jar extension is created, but it does not contain a valid MANIFEST.MF file. According to the documentation, the outjar parameter is supposed to put the output classes in a zip file, but it doesn't make sense for it to create a zip file instead of a jar file.
OB: The ajc outjar command should create a valid jar file that includes the MANIFEST.MF file.
EB: If the outjar parameter is used, the resulting file should be a valid jar file with a MANIFEST.MF file.
SR: Make sure that the outjar command creates a valid jar file with a MANIFEST.MF file when it is used.
